title: Understanding U.S. Taxes
body: Taxes are money that people pay to the government. As an international student, understanding U.S. taxes is important because you must file tax forms each year while studying in America.
When you work in the U.S., you pay different types of taxes:
• Federal Income Tax - Money paid to the U.S. government
• State Income Tax - Money paid to your state
• Social Security and Medicare - Special taxes for retirement and healthcare
Important Tax Due Dates:
• January: You get your tax forms (W-2, 1098-T)
• April 15: Deadline to file your tax return
Special Rules for International Students:
• You use different tax forms than U.S. students
• You might pay different tax rates
• Some countries have special tax agreements with the U.S.
• You need to report money from jobs, scholarships, and grants

questions.question: When is the main tax deadline in the U.S.?
questions.explanation: Tax returns are due by April 15th each year

title: Important Tax Forms
body: As an international student, you need to know these forms:
Form W-2:
• Shows how much you earned from your job
• Lists taxes already taken from your paycheck
• Your employer sends this by January 31st
Form 1098-T:
• Shows your tuition payments
• Lists scholarship and grant money
• Your school sends this form
Form 1040NR:
• The main tax form for international students
• You use this to report all your income
• Shows if you get money back or need to pay more

title: Tax Terms You Need to Know
body: Here are important words you'll see when doing taxes:
Income:
• Money you earn from jobs
• Scholarship money that isn't for tuition
• Interest from bank accounts
Deductions:
• Education expenses you can subtract
• Some school supplies and books
• Student loan interest payments
Tax Credits:
• Money that reduces your taxes
• Some education expenses qualify
• Different rules apply for international students

questions.question: Which form shows your school payments?
questions.explanation: Form 1098-T shows your tuition and scholarship information
